Message.Title: Regulators Wary of Boeing's Plan to Fix the Dreamliner
Message.Msg: Japan's preponderance of Dreamliners means that even though Boeing is an iconic American company, Japanese regulators actually have far more clout than US regulators in determining when and how the 787 gets back in the air. For Boeing, the opportunity is absolutely massive. However, the company's execution problems and emerging competitors have investors wondering whether Boeing will live up to its shareholder responsibilities. While the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration is not yet ready to allow test flights , Japanese regulators aren't even ready to admit that the battery itself is the problem, , Japanese transport minister Akihiro Ota called Boeing's plan a "starting point" and indicated that his ministry would need to take some time just to evaluate the proposal to see if its satisfactory. If Japanese regulators don't accept that the battery is at fault, and require Boeing to go back to the drawing board for a more comprehensive fix, resuming flights by April would look very unrealistic.

Message.Title: Good-by Boeing dictator, SEC orders vote to split Boeing CEO, chairman roles maybe !
Message.Msg: To those who argue the board should decide its own management structure, all I can say is "How's that been working' out for you?"The documents between BA and John Chevedden and the SEC are interesting reading ,The typical BA response is right out of the cookbook used by Perkins Coie and sometimes even Boeing Counsel offices. Boeing must let investors vote on splitting the roles of chief executive officer and chairman to strengthen oversight, the Securities and Exchange Commission said. Chevedden’s plan would require that an independent director lead Boeing’s board instead of the CEO, according to SEC documents. The proposal gives the company the option to put off separating the roles until McNerney, 63, leaves. Boeing shares have climbed 2.5 percent this year, trailing the Dow Jones Index by 6.5 percent and the Dow Jones average , as Dreamliner’s woes mounted. Through Thursday, the stock has lagged by over 11% percent of the whole average of good and bad stocks since McNerney took over as CEO in July 2005, compared with 27.1 gain percent for the S&P 500.Boeing has also trailed the Dow by a wide margin since the CEO took over Boeing. One major problem besides the wrong man for the job, the wrong man has both the Chairman and CEO jobs, which is like being the dictator of North Korea. Boeing has sought to block a vote, messages to the SEC show.. Before shooing McNerney out the door, there are 2 other GE alumni on the Boeing board of directors. It would be no surprise if they are McNerney's CEO 'backups' Boeing and the friends brothers and in-laws who hold large institutional shares will fight this vote with everything they have in the false and misleading tool box. What you want to make the CEO responsible to the Board of Directors? Why. Why, John Chevedden statement “There is a direct link between the behaviors that led to this financial collapse and the short-term compensation programs so common in financial services companies( and other companie

Like he had a choice, be a loser for the end of his career or move on to Ford. Mulally would much rather had the Boeing job, but he was too stupid to get over himself and the mantra of unions are bad and all that stinking thinking. I sure hope he will never get back to Boeing. the last good CEO was T A Wilson he was responsible for all the great planes. So after he retired the great Boeing planes 1943 to 1987 from B-52 to the 777 , nothing since Wilson retired has Boeing been any good. Message.Title: Union or Job
Message.Msg: Union---give me, give me, give me! I worked for Hyatt Clark Ind. Inc. in Clark New Jersey, which was formerly New Depature Hyatt Roller Bearing a divison of GM. When GM sold the plant to the employees it became HCI. The company turned it around and the quality went from 63% to over 84% with the same machinery. What happened that the company collapsed- the company closed. It was the UAW which we joined. "THEY" the UNION, the UAW, told everyone to stage a slowdown. Well Stupid, you can't have a slowdown against yourself just because you disagree with management. If you don't make the bearings then GM your only customer wont get there product and will go else where. See, management didn't want to give out the profits for the year. OK, so put it back into the company, yes. But management should have given 25% of profits to workers. HCI was a profit sharing company. Ok, but you don't tell your union brothers to slowdown. SO, GM said that if we couldn't resolve our difference it will buy their bearings some where else. Well they did. Why, because the UAW is so hard headed that it can't see past their own greed. I WOULD RATHER HAVE A JOB THAT PAYS A BIT LESS THEN WHAT I'M RECEIVING AND PAY 40% FOR MY HEALTH PLAN AND HAVE A JOB,---THEN NOT HAVE A JOB! STUPID #$%$_KEN UNION! THEY ARE GOOD FOR THE WORKER BUT THE UAW WILL ULTIMATELY BE THE WORKERS DEMISE. I say strong sell because GM is going down at the hands of the UAW!

Message.Title: Here's what the 47% got Romney
Message.Msg: Mitt Romney says it "kills" him that he's not president. But he doesn't blame Superstorm Sandy, New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie or anything else on his loss to President Barack Obama--except his campaign's failure to connect with minority voters. “I lost my election because of my campaign," Romney said in an interview broadcast on "Fox News Sunday," his first television interview since his November defeat. "Not because of what anyone else did." The former Massachusetts governor refused place blame on Christie, who some Republicans say gave Obama a last-minute lift in his embrace of the president in the wake of the storm. Romney said his inability to win over black and Hispanic voters--and the damage done by those disastrous "47 percent" comments--ultimately derailed his White House bid. [So keep at it, right-fringers. Soon you'll ALL be able to join mittens in a giant cry-in-your-beer garten.]

I'm not sure who put those ideas into his head, but I think it may have been a well laid out trap from the left and he fell for it, hook, line, and sinker. The democrats always go for the throat if the Republican candidate is a successful and wealthy businessman, as though there has never been a rich and super wealthy democrat. Dems always label Republicans as the party of and for the rich. Mitt gave them a good target to do just that.

Topic.Title: SPEEA leaders wave the white flag

Message.Msg: Phantom.. There is a lesson to be learned for the unions, for the states and for our country of the ongoing challenge for businesses located in non-right-to-work states. If our own government is willing to give a defense contract to a foreign-owned entity over multiple, capable U.S.-owned entities - including one that incumbently held the previous contract - because of pricing, other entities will be focused on pricing too. States that continue to prioritize union ideology over the need to be competitive may end up with no work at all. Case in point: the contract to replace the old issue M4 rifles with the newer M4A1 worth $77M. Colt and Remington bid but lost out to A Belgian government owned company, FN Herstal. Herstal will build the rifles in a non union facility in South Caroline. Colt was going to build them at their union plant in Connecticut and Remington was going to build them at in its union plant in Ilion, N.Y., facility.

Topic.Title: Cupcakes and Flu Shots for Syria

Message.Msg: Neither are the Russians inclined to upset the apple cart of Obama's and the other 47%'s delusion regarding his ("methinks the man doth protest too much") notion of "I am NOT a dictator" - though the opposite is apparently true: 1) this is the most "transparent" administration in history; 2) "I was told not to discuss the (obviously overt) drone program" (Robert Gibbs, former Obama Press Secretary); 3) what we are doing in Libya is a "kinetic action" and does not require Congressional approval; 4) what happened in Benghazi "is the result of a video"; 5) "we do not have a spending problem"; 6) "I will uphold the Constitution of the United States" ..... etc). The Russians, the Iranians, and the North Koreans do not need to do anything. The President and his team are doing it for them.

Topic.Title: Gun Grabbers are Holocaust Deniers

Message.Msg: The Constitution is everything to me! Why do the President and Politicians feel otherwise? Gun manufacturer will be airlifting weapons and munitions into Colorado before Colorado Democrats enact severe new anti weapons ban. Manufacturer claims this is their America's Berlin Airlift.

Message.Title: 737 Max Plane ?
Message.Msg: Haven't heard much about the new 737 MAX plane that was all the talk, about 2 years ago.I remember the state of washington and the Union were smooching Boeing in keeping the work in that state. Not due for production till 2016 but Boeing is taking sale orders now. Will it be built where?
